posts.post_content:
Another locus ([Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost)) is being printed in Scars of Mirrodin.  
  
If you have 4 of these, 4 Glimmerposts, and 4 Vesuva copies of these... Each of these would tap for 12, so that's 96 for all 8 Cloudposts. And another 4 for the Glimmerposts. 12 lands tapping for 100 mana? Yeah, sure, it's colorless, but it's also 100 mana.
posts.html:
Another locus (Glimmerpost) is being printed in Scars of Mirrodin.

If you have 4 of these, 4 Glimmerposts, and 4 Vesuva copies of these... Each of these would tap for 12, so that's 96 for all 8 Cloudposts. And another 4 for the Glimmerposts. 12 lands tapping for 100 mana? Yeah, sure, it's colorless, but it's also 100 mana.

Posted By: Andon_A (9/21/2010 10:52:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He meant shapeshifter i.e. duplicant, because its colorless mana.. not because it affects lands.
  
   
Ah, cloud post.. bane of my creature deck's existence.. it wouldn't have been so bad if it said something like.. if you have another cloud post in play this land produces +1 colorless mana so that it would only be 2 per land at max. Unfortunately between cloud posts and vesuvas instead it turns into playing darksteel colossus on turn 5, or a fast master transmuter into a sphinx of the steel wind. Mirrodin made artifacts so nuts it seems like they have been making up for it for the past few sets by not printing very many. I mean.. seriously, isochron scepter, lightning greaves, duplicant, and loxodon warhammer all in the same set?
  
   
Having said all that, best card for artifacts decks you could want, makes just about anything castable when you have only 2 out.
posts.html:
He meant shapeshifter i.e. duplicant, because its colorless mana.. not because it affects lands.

Mirrodin made artifacts so nuts it seems like they have been making up for it for the past few sets by not printing very many. I mean.. seriously, isochron scepter, lightning greaves, duplicant, and loxodon warhammer all in the same set?

Having said all that, best card for artifacts decks you could want, makes just about anything castable when you have only 2 out.

Posted By: TheSwarm (10/3/2010 5:44:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I had no idea this card even existed. As a common that adds colorless and comes in tapped, it just flies under the radar...  
  
...until you play someone running a colorless deck with 4 of these, 4 Vesuvas and 4 Glimmerposts. Having 12 mana available on turn 4 (with a tapped land, meaning at least 16 next turn), JUST FROM LANDS, is ridiculous. Admittedly, it requires them to actually have multiple Locii, but even with 2 Cloudposts they're getting 4 mana from 2 lands. And it's not like colorless decks are super weak or anything. ^^
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Note, that having 12 Posts/Locii would probably actualy have been fair if we didn't have Amulet of Vigor. I think. Coming into play tapped is the last thing a fast combo deck wants it's lands to do. Not being able to play anything the first 3 turns of the game is not a good strategy.

Posted By: don_miguel (5/3/2010 9:52:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @ Donovan\_Fabian: what are you talking about? You can run four in a deck which means you can have one producing 4 colorless and all 4 producing a total of 16. Combo with four [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva) to get 8 colorless per tap, and 64 total. Also if you're running these in a deck with a splash of blue then you can combo with [Mistform Wakecaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mistform Wakecaster) use 2nd ability and get even more. Basically this card owns especially because of the new emergence of colorless eldrazi. Also if you aren't too big on using fat creatures then you can just do the same thing, get a splash of red and [Blaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blaze) or [Fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireball) or [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm) for an insta-win. Or if you're a green user, [Stream of Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stream of Life). No doubt that this card has other uses that i haven't thought of and even with the ones that i've just listed i think it still deserves the 5/5.
posts.html:
@ Donovan_Fabian: what are you talking about? You can run four in a deck which means you can have one producing 4 colorless and all 4 producing a total of 16. Combo with four Vesuva to get 8 colorless per tap, and 64 total. Also if you're running these in a deck with a splash of blue then you can combo with Mistform Wakecaster use 2nd ability and get even more. Basically this card owns especially because of the new emergence of colorless eldrazi. Also if you aren't too big on using fat creatures then you can just do the same thing, get a splash of red and Blaze or Fireball or Comet Storm for an insta-win. Or if you're a green user, Stream of Life. No doubt that this card has other uses that i haven't thought of and even with the ones that i've just listed i think it still deserves the 5/5.
